meanings.definition: In a sneaky or deceitful manner.
meanings.sent1: He crept sneakingly through the dark alley, trying not to be seen.
meanings.sent2: She peeked sneakingly around the corner to see if anyone was watching.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon sneakingly stole the cookies from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The shadows moved sneakingly across the wall, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The spy moved sneakingly through the enemy's headquarters, gathering valuable information without being detected.

meanings.definition: Done in a secretive or furtive way.
meanings.sent1: The cat made a sneakingly quiet approach towards the bird feeder.
meanings.sent2: He had a sneakingly clever plan to surprise his friends at the party.
meanings.sent3: The students giggled at their sneakingly clever prank on the teacher.
meanings.sent4: The fog enveloped the town in a sneakingly mysterious embrace.
meanings.sent5: The thief made a sneakingly swift escape from the scene of the crime before anyone noticed.
